summary: PFAS (per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances) are a class of heat- and stain-resistant chemicals used in products ranging from nonstick cookware to some firefighting foams. Continued exposure above certain levels to the most widely studied PFAS—which can stay in the environment for decades—can cause health problems, including cancer. The EPA recently completed 2 actions in response to congressional direction, including issuing a rule that requires reviews...
title: Man-Made Chemicals and Potential Health Risks: EPA Has Completed Some Regulatory-Related Actions for PFAS
